CatDescriptText: Albert Brown, salesman and accountant, Homewood, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 19, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "what action, if any, should be taken and by whom, when Negro members of integrated teams refuse to play before segregated crowds?" Answer reads: "The team's organization should take the first step.  If they don't do what's right in the line of advancing democracy, then the team members should take up the torch and carry it."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Albert Brown wearing dot patterned shirt and hat, standing in front of ribbed metal wall
